## Firewall
---
This workbook requires the following data connectors:

| Log | Requirements | Steps |
|:------------- |:-------------|:-----|
| Windows Firewall | Sentinel connector, Agent, Firewall log| Install Windows Firewall connector and monitor agent, Enable firewall logging on host|
| Windows Security Events (minimal)| Sentinel connector, Agent| Enable Security Event connector (minimal) and monitor agent |
| Azure Signin | Sentinel connector, Diagnostics setting| Create Diagnostics setting for signinlogs|

parameters.name: Computers
parameters.query:
Heartbeat
| where Solutions contains "windowsFirewall"
| distinct Computer

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where Solutions contains "windowsFirewall"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer
| project Computer, ['Last update'] = TimeGenerated, OSInfo = strcat(OSType, " ", OSName, " ", OSMajorVersion)
| top 10 by ['Last update'] desc
content.title: Active connected computers

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where Solutions contains "windowsFirewall"
| summarize dcount(Computer), ActiveComputers = makeset(Computer) by bin(TimeGenerated, 15m)
content.title: Active connected computers timeline

content.json:
----
## Firewall events

General information about firewall port, IP's, protocols and actions

content.query:
let commonPorts = dynamic({"443": "HTTPS", "80":"HTTP", "3389":"RDP", "53":"DNS", "389":"LDAP", "445":"SMB", "135":"RPC", "47001":"WinRM","22":"ssh", "21": "ftp"}); // Set of common portnames
let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
WindowsFirewall 
| where isnotempty(DestinationPort) and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers)) // Filter giver computers from parameter
| summarize Dropped = countif(FirewallAction =~ "DROP"), Allowed = countif(FirewallAction =~ "ALLOW"), Total = count() by tostring(DestinationPort), Protocol
| extend portName = iff(commonPorts contains DestinationPort, commonPorts[DestinationPort],DestinationPort)
| sort by Total desc
| project ["Destination Port"] = DestinationPort,['Core Protocol'] = Protocol , ["Default Protocol"] = portName, Total, Allowed, Dropped

let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
WindowsFirewall 
| where isnotempty(DestinationPort) and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers))// Filter giver computers from parameter
| summarize Allowed = count() by tostring(DestinationPort)
| sort by Allowed desc
| project DestinationPort, Allowed
content.title: Allowed Connections by Port

content.query:
let commonPorts = dynamic({"443": "HTTPS", "80":"HTTP", "3389":"RDP", "53":"DNS", "389":"LDAP", "445":"SMB", "135":"RPC", "47001":"WinRM","22":"ssh", "21": "ftp"}); // Set of common portnames

content.query:
let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
SecurityEvent
| where AccountType == "User" and  isnotempty(IpAddress) and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or param_Computers == "")
| summarize EventCount = count(), DistinctIPCount = dcount(IpAddress),IPAddresses = makeset(IpAddress) by Account, Computer
| top 10 by DistinctIPCount desc
| extend machineAccount = strcat(Account," - ",Computer)
| project Account, Computer, ['Distinct IP Count'] = DistinctIPCount, ['Event Count'] = EventCount, IPAddresses
content.title: Windows Security Events by Account

content.json:
---- ## Correlation These visuals give a representation of the Windows firewall, security log and Azure signins events. Results below could mean a targeted attack to an organization's private and public cloud.
This can also be used to monitor the organization's most used IP's

content.query:
let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
WindowsFirewall 
| where (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers))
| summarize FirewallEvents = count() by SourceIP
| join kind = inner(
   SigninLogs
   | summarize SuccessAzureLogin = countif(ResultType == 0), FailedAzureLogin = countif(ResultType != 0) by SourceIP = IPAddress
) on SourceIP
| join kind = inner(
    SecurityEvent
    | where LogonType == 10 
    | summarize SucessRDPLogin = countif(EventID == 4624), FailedRDPlogin = countif(EventID == 4625) by SourceIP = IpAddress, Computer
) on SourceIP
| project SourceIP , Computer, ['Firewall events']=FirewallEvents, ['Success Azure logins']=SuccessAzureLogin, ['Failed Azure logins']=FailedAzureLogin, ['Success RDP logins']=SucessRDPLogin, ['Failed RDP logins']=FailedRDPlogin
| sort by ['Failed RDP logins'],['Failed Azure logins'] desc
content.title: Correlating events between windows firewall, security logs and Azure signins
content.noDataMessage: No links between Windows firewall and azure logins (positive)

content.query:
let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
SecurityEvent
| where AccountType == "User" and LogonType == 10 and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers))
| summarize FailedRDPLogins = countif(EventID == 4625), SuccessRDPLogins = countif(EventID == 4624) by IpAddress, Computer
| join kind= inner (
    WindowsFirewall
    | where DestinationPort == 3389 and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers))
    | summarize FirewallDropped = countif(FirewallAction =~ "DROP"), FirewallAllowed = countif(FirewallAction =~ "ALLOW") by SourceIP 
) on $left.IpAddress == $right.SourceIP 
| project Computer, IpAddress, FailedRDPLogins, SuccessRDPLogins, FirewallDropped, FirewallAllowed
| sort by SuccessRDPLogins, FailedRDPLogins desc
content.title: Correlating events between Windows firewall and security logs

content.query:
let param_Computers = "{Computers}";
WindowsFirewall
| where (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers)) and SourceIP !in ("::1","-")
| summarize FirewallEvents = count() by SourceIP
| join(
SecurityEvent
| where isnotempty(IpAddress) and (Computer == param_Computers or param_Computers contains Computer or isempty(param_Computers))
| summarize SecurityEvents = count() by SourceIP = IpAddress
) on SourceIP
| top 15 by FirewallEvents desc
| project SourceIP, SecurityEvents, FirewallEvents
content.title: Correlating IPs between Windows firewall and security logs
